oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tom T. Hall Interview by Bob Allen 1-15-82
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Tom T. Hall by Bob Allen. The interview takes place on 1-15-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tom T. Hall;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Tape One, Side One - (0:25) -- Interview introduction with Tom T. Hall expectations of a country & western songwriter. "How can you be a country & western songwriter, and be sane?" - Tom T. Hall. (2:08) -- Tom T. Hall discusses a book about Elvis that criticizes his behavior. "The whole book is about Elvis not being normal...And that's ridiculous." - Tom T. Hall. (3:40) -- "We should accept our little insanities and enjoy them and make the most of them" - Tom T. Hall. (6:02) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about his last trip. Tom T. Hall discusses a recent trip/tour to Australia. (6:50) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about hitchhiking to Chicago. (8:41) -- Tom T. Hall tells a story about riding in the back of a bus. (10:06) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about traveling through Chicago seeking shelter from the cold. (11:22) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about hitchhiking back from Chicago. (12:33) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about when he first decided to move to Nashville. (15:15) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about his working aspirations before he came to Nashville. Tom T. Hall mentions that he left high school as a freshman. (17:36) -- Tom T. Hall mentions being harassed by a radio station manager when he was working as a disc jockey. (18:52) -- Bob Allen asks about whether Tom T. Hall felt reluctance about coming to Nashville. "I never really thought I was the average picker...I didn't think that I was like the rest of them" - Tom T. Hall. (23:23) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about enjoying the anonymity of dressing as a soldier while working as a songwriter. (24:10) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall whether he considered himself a loner when he first came to Nashville. (25:55) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about his typical workday as a disc jockey. (28:04) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about authors that have influenced his songwriting. Tom T. Hall immediately mentions Sinclair Lewis. (30:52) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about the allure of nightclubs. (31:54) -- Bob Allen asks about whether Tom T. Hall sent RCA music. Tom T. Hall goes on to tell a story about pitching music to RCA Victor. (34:10) -- Bob Allen begins discussion about modern day "TV artists." Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about current songwriting trends. (35:48) -- "There's no such thing as a bad hit record" - Tom T. Hall. (40:04) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about painful songwriting subjects he's written about and self-discovery. (41:28) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about finding humor in previous unfortunate situations. (43:20) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about a tumultuous period of time in his life.
